Each refill can last up to an entire month and the scent is very soothing, subtle, and doesn't have overpoweringly strong smells. FAQs Are Air Fresheners Toxic? Some air fresheners can contain [toxic substances](https://home.howstuffworks.com/home-improvement/household-safety/air-freshener-dangers.htm), including volatile organic compounds (VOCs), which can contribute to poor indoor air quality and negative health problems. Chemicals like formaldehyde and phthalates are often found in room fresheners and have been associated with respiratory problems, allergies, and hormone disruption. Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) in air fresheners are toxic due to their ability to contribute to poor indoor air quality. VOCs can irritate the respiratory system, trigger allergies, weaken the immune systems, and lead to headaches and dizziness. Phthalates Phthalates are known as endocrine disruptors, which can interfere with hormonal balance and lead to reproductive issues, and developmental problems. This chemical have also been linked to respiratory irritation and allergic reactions. Formaldehyde Toxic air fresheners sometimes contain formaldehyde which can cause respiratory irritation and allergic reactions. It can cause irritation in the eyes, nose, and throat. This chemical can also increase the risk of certain cancers. Are Air Fresheners Toxic For Pets? Air fresheners can be toxic to pets in similar ways as it does to humans. Toxic air fresheners can potentially cause respiratory issues and allergic reactions. Since pets have sensitive respiratory systems, the strong toxic odors from air fresheners can irritate their lungs and lead to coughing. Some ingredients can even be toxic to pets if ingested or inhaled. So it's best to use pet-friendly air fresheners instead. How To Choose a Non-Toxic & Sustainable Air Freshener? Natural Ingredients Choose non-toxic ingredients that are plant-based and made without synthetic fragrances. Some common ingredients include non toxic essential oils, plant extracts, baking soda, and activated charcoal. Fragrances without phthalates, formaldehyde, VOCs, and other toxical chemicals are less likely to cause allergic reactions and skin irritations. Packaging Go for safe air fresheners that are not only toxin-free but also use sustainable packaging. Usually, this includes packaging made of recycled materials or biodegradable materials. Eco-friendly Practices Choose to buy from nontoxic brands that have initiatives to minimize waste, use renewable energy sources, and support environmental practices.
